washed piece of fruit and a tiny pinpoint reflection in a picture was the only evidence

there was a thunderstorm in Collingwood Ontario

but the rain didn't stop 33 year old Debbie 10 lakh from venturing out that night she was a pretty vicious woman that loves to ski sailboat harbor she like to sail and she like the debate a single mother left her 6 year old daughter laci at her parents home for the night Debbie and a few of her friends went to a local restaurant where they visited with each other and it was later in the evening when Debbie and her friends said goodbye to each other in the parking lot
our friend said Debbie left alone and presumably went straight home
at 325 in the morning however she phoned police to report she had been attacked
she indicated she had been assaulted I don't believe she was in total understanding of what had occurred she was struggling to stay conscious

out side the kitchen window was an area partially hidden behind some greenery
on the ground investigators noticed tomato

Debbie Tim walk had a tomato on her windowsill right pending and the tomato had likely been dragged out onto the ground when the suspect had pulled the blinds over the window when we noticed the tomato was quite obvious that there was a partial footwear impression on the tomato itself
they photographed the tomato then put it in Debbie's refrigerator to preserve it
police found no foreign fingerprints in the apartment and there were no valuables missing so investigators had to ask who would've wanted deadbeat dad that question produced a few troubling answers

and Debbie 10 lakhs autopsy the medical examiner found she had been sexually assaulted and stabbed to death she died of a stab wound to the heart he also found that there was a stab wound to the back which penetrated her spinal cord

the pathologist concluded that Debbie was paralyzed from the waist down when she crawled to the telephone to call police I believe when Debbie is told by the ambulance help is on the way she responds thank you and I believe at that point she died
in the search for Debbie's killer investigators found a possible lead
4 years earlier Debbie lived with a man named Ron Osborne who had been involved in a drug smuggling ring
in 198510 persons were investigated for attempting to smuggle drugs from United States into Canada authorities had evidence that Osborne transported illegal drugs in a boat from Jamaica to Florida

at Osborne's trial debate reluctantly testified against him Debbie testified that Ron was born had told her that he had been on a boat for 2 month period this boat is the one that was subsequently found to have storage compartments where the drugs had been stored and Osborne was in prison at the time of Debbie's murder but investigators checked to see whether any of the other defendants might have killed her
transcription of the drug smuggling case were reviewed along with interviews of the investigating officers to determine where all the players actually were and how the entire investigation unfolded

detectives concluded there was no connection to Debbie's merger to us it made no sense that a small player like Debbie Tim log would be murdered in this drug investigation because she really had very little to do with it
as a matter of routine police also interviewed Debbie's ex husband the couple had been divorced for 4 years and shared custody of 6 year old laci

it was a good guy and it just happens that they don't you know some people just don't get along together it was a renewable divorce both parties said got on with their lives and gone in different directions and the ex husband of Debbie was alibi up he was at home at night
so investigators focused on the evidence left at the scene
Paravai glasses and the tomato with the foot impression we knew right away that we had a pattern in the tomato and we knew right away that it was a herringbone pattern

when the film was developed and analyzed the flash in the photo created distinct shadows we could see that along with the herringbone pattern was a second pattern or more detail than we've had first been able to see which was an S. shape that came through the herringbone pattern
next investigators analyzed the eye glasses

they found that these blood on the glasses which told the story both of the arms were folded which to us we we believe had fallen out of someone's pocket Debbie had dragged herself to the phone from the bedroom and had actually dragged herself over those glasses
since Debbie didn't wear glasses investigators assumed they belonged to the killer

there was an expensive and the lenses didn't fit properly in the frame the lends itself didn't exactly match the contour of the metal piece at the top so creating sort of a gap in the appearance of the lenses
it was clear they've been warned for some time
and there was a size discrepancy between the 2 lenses it was as if a portion of the lands had been ground off so that they just weren't the same shape which is highly unusual
then investigators got an important lead they learned that Debbie's former next door neighbor was 23 year old James Brown a one time Olympic hopefuls
brown had had some success in the sport of wrestling and had actually been to Japan where he hopes to further that and maybe have a shot at an Olympic spot on the team

Debbie told friends that brown had made advances towards her he did have a criminal record he had been convicted of a number of fences in the past so many for assaults thefts and break and enters that is why brown came on the radar screen quite rapidly he had done some time in jail but never more than 3 months
when questioned brown denied any involvement in Debbie's merger and said he was out of town on the night of the crime
he indicated that he had been at a hotel where he was assaulted by persons unknown and as a result of that he went to the ground and he woke up on the side of the road several miles away
brown had scratches on his face which he said came from the assault
given his size detectives were skeptical of his story she was the man some 6 foot 3 and height large structure about 350 some pounds wide shoulders extremely white fists
and detectives noticed something else
in his mug shots from a previous arrest
brown was wearing glasses
the prime suspect in deadly 10 lakhs merger was her former next door neighbor a convicted criminal Jim Brown

they remove Debbie's blood from the glasses and had an officer posed as a nurse and offer them to brown
nobody hears me do

it doesn't mean they're not his it just means that we haven't got that can activity yet
police searched brown's apartment and his car we found a pair of blue canvas running shoes on the floor of the rear right passenger side of the vehicle
we believe they were manufactured in Czechoslovakia in were actually purchased by the Ontario government and were provided to inmates in the the provincial system
who are doing time

she also appeared to have the same distinctive tread pattern as the print on the tomato outside Debbie's window there is a specific part of the design which are referred to here is either a Nash a porous stylized 7 that became very apparent in the photograph that really piqued my interest
but forensic investigator Jerry Webb had a problem
he needed to know if the weight of a 350 pound man created a different kind of shoe impression on a tomato then one you'd get by copying the shoe impression on paper or a transparency
so we have designed an experiment

I had a person not war size 13 shoes are put on a bomb suit and I added weight to the bomb suit in trying to increase the weight of this person to be more close to the weight of the suspect in this case Jim Brown
we had sprayed water on tomatoes to simulate the rain storm on the night of the murder
then had his 350 pound model step on each one wearing the suspect shoes

we have discovered that the test impression on the tomato was virtually the same as the one taken directly from the shoe and the photo taken at the crime scene I was able to take those 2 overlays and put them over top of a photograph of the tomato itself and be able to illustrate that in fact that the pattern matched up on the tomato impression
although the size of brown shoe and the tread pattern was the same as a shoe impression left at the crime scene there was no way to tell if this was the actual shoe
the impression on the tomato could have been made by the left shoe of Jim Brown or it could have been made by another left shoe that had the same specific design and size
since the shoes were present issued they were unusual although not uncommon
I feel that we need much more evidence to convict the person responsible for Debbie 10 lakh senseless murder
so they turn to the eye glasses found at the crime scene

Dr Graham strong a professor of optometry at Waterloo university was asked to determine whether the crime scene glasses were the same as those worn by Jim Brown in a police mugshot taken several years earlier

the problem we had with the mug shots is that they really weren't a frontal mugshot he was angle relative to the plane of the film to solve the problem Dr strong mounted the glasses on a styrofoam head and tried to approximate the angle in the mug shots
we didn't get it quite right it was compelling but it didn't rise to a level that was significant in our mind
then Dr strong in large the mug shot photographs and noticed something important
tiny white dots reflections from the photographer's flash in brown's corneas

you actually use the reflection from the front surface of the eye to make a very standard measurement when you make a pair of glasses namely the distance between the 2 sides so that what you do is you measure the difference between there the reflection from the right outside to the left side and that's the inter pupillary distance

for a medical records Dr strong you that the distance between brown's pupils was 72 millimeters so now he had a scale by which you could measure the exact size of the frames and the lenses for comparison to the glasses from the crime scene we're getting 20 odd identical measurements and observations related to the glasses so there's a bit of a Eureka moment when that happens

bottom line was the glasses in evidence belonged to the accused and in fact were the ones that were worn in both of the mug shot so we analyzed we believe we have the Browns glasses covered with blood in Debbie's apartment but if that were true why would the frames in the mug shots and gold and the frames analyzed by the expert brown
after thousands of hours of police and forensic investigation prosecutors now knew what happened in derby 10 lakhs apartment on the night she was murdered
it was a very warm night and the evidence shows that when Debbie returned from an evening with friends she opened the kitchen window to help cool her apartment then she went to sleep

it was a ground floor apartment the kitchen window was low the motive was unclear but the evidence shows James Brown entered Debbie's apartment and knocked the tomato off the window sill then stepped on it leaving the impression of this prison shoes
brown attacked Debbie in the bedroom assaulted her stabbed her twice with a knife and left her for dead
on his way out he dropped his classes in the whole way

she died before she could identify her attacker

in January of 19922.5 years after Debbie 10 lakh was killed James Brown went on trial for murder
the trial lasted 2.5 weeks and relied on the shoe print left on a tomato and mathematical calculations from the reflection of a flash bulb
the jury deliberated for 6:00 hours and came back with a fine of first degree murder in Canada first we murder conviction carries an automatic life sentence with no chance of parole for 25 years
this case ranks among the most unusual in forensic history
was unique in fact to this day and I've I've been policing now for 28 years and 20 years the friends business I've never before never again had an impression in a tomato
